  sgcool_label_text: This programme booklet contains information about the music and dance performance by the Experimental Theatre Group at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund
 the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place
 it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies
 as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.

The woman is clenching one of her fists and the man has his right arm raised. The man is wearing a hat and the lady has a cloth tied around her head and neck.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This programme booklet contains information about the music and dance performance by the Experimental Theatre Group at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund, the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place, it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies, as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.
